metadata.title: Trustix Secure Linux der_chop Script Symlink Attack Vulnerability
metadata.description: The der_chop script in the openssl package in Trustix Secure Linux 1.5 through 2.1 and other operating systems allows local users to overwrite files via a symlink attack on temporary files.

criteria.comment: openssl, openssl-devel, OR openssl-perl older than 0.9.7a-33.15 or openssl096b older than 0.9.6b-16.22.3

metadata.title: Gaim DoS via Malformed MSN Message
metadata.description: Gaim before 1.3.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a malformed MSN message that leads to a memory allocation of a large size, possibly due to an integer signedness error.

metadata.title: shtool Race Condition
metadata.description: Race condition in shtool 2.0.1 and earlier allows local users to create or modify arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the .shtool.$$ temporary file, a different vulnerability than CVE-2005-1759.

metadata.title: PEAR XML_RPC PHP Code Execution Vulnerability
metadata.description: Eval injection vulnerability in PEAR XML_RPC 1.3.0 and earlier (aka XML-RPC or xmlrpc) and PHPXMLRPC (aka XML-RPC For PHP or php-xmlrpc) 1.1 and earlier, as used in products such as (1) WordPress, (2) Serendipity, (3) Drupal, (4) egroupware, (5) MailWatch, (6) TikiWiki, (7) phpWebSite, (8) Ampache, and others, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via an XML file, which is not properly sanitized before being used in an eval statement.

metadata.title: cpio Race Condition
metadata.description: Race condition in cpio 2.6 and earlier allows local users to modify permissions of arbitrary files via a hard link attack on a file while it is being decompressed, whose permissions are changed by cpio after the decompression is complete.

metadata.title: gzip Directory Traversal Vulnerability
metadata.description: Directory traversal vulnerability in gunzip -N in gzip 1.2.4 through 1.3.5 allows remote attackers to write to arbitrary directories via a .. (dot dot) in the original filename within a compressed file.

metadata.title: RHE4 InstallVersion.compareTo() DoS and Code Execution Vulnerability
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5, Mozilla before 1.7.9, and Netscape 8.0.2 and 7.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (access violation and crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code, by calling InstallVersion.compareTo with an object instead of a string.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: Bind OPT Resource Record DoS Vulnerability
metadata.description: BIND 8.3.x through 8.3.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (termination due to assertion failure) via a request for a subdomain that does not exist, with an OPT resource record with a large UDP payload size.

criterion.comment: Internet Domain Name Server (BIND, SUNWinamd) installed

metadata.title: RHE4 Firefox and Mozilla Shared Object Code Execution
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5 and Mozilla before 1.7.9 does not properly clone base objects, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by navigating the prototype chain to reach a privileged object.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: rwho daemon Code Execution Vulnerability
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in the rwho daemon (in.rwhod) for Solaris 7 through 9 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

criteria.comment: Solaris 7 or 8 OR Solaris 9 and Remote Network Server Commands (SUNWrcmds) installed
Solaris 9 and Remote Network Server Commands (SUNWrcmds) installed

criterion.comment: Remote Network Server Commands - Usr (SUNWrcmds) installed

metadata.title: HP-UX Running xterm Local Unauthorized Access
metadata.description: Unspecified vulnerability in xterm for HP-UX 11.00, 11.11, and 11.23 allows local users to gain privileges via unknown vectors.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02075
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:tst:3901 - HP-UX Security Advisory - HPSBUX02944_101
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:tst:3704 - HP-UX Security Advisories published in February 2014

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02075
Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02075
Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02075

metadata.title: sysreport Plaintext Password Leak
metadata.description: sysreport 1.3.15 and earlier includes contents of the up2date file in a report, which leaks the password for a proxy server in plaintext and allows local users to gain privileges.

metadata.title: RHE3 Firefox and Mozilla Framed Site Spoofing Vulnerability
metadata.description: A regression error in Firefox 1.0.3 and Mozilla 1.7.7 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary Javascript from one page into the frameset of another site, aka the frame injection spoofing vulnerability, a re-introduction of a vulnerability that was originally identified and addressed by CVE-2004-0718.

metadata.title: mikmod Long Filename Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in mikmod 3.1.6 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via an archive file that contains a file with a long filename.

metadata.title: PostgreSQL Character Conversion Vulnerability
metadata.description: PostgreSQL 7.3.x through 8.0.x gives public EXECUTE access to certain character conversion functions, which allows unprivileged users to call those functions with malicious values, with unknown impact, aka the "Character conversion vulnerability."

criterion.comment: postmaster (the PostgreSQL master daemon) is running

metadata.title: ImageMagick Buffer Overflow in ReadPNMImage()
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the ReadPNMImage function in pnm.c for ImageMagick 6.2.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a PNM file with a small colors value.

metadata.title: gftp Directory Traversal Vulnerability
metadata.description: Directory traversal vulnerability in gftp before 2.0.18 for GTK+ allows remote malicious FTP servers to read arbitrary files via .. (dot dot) sequences in filenames returned from a LIST command.

modified.comment: modified upt-62 - Changed DATA operation to OR (to test for any exec bit set, not all). Fixed typo in comment.

metadata.title: RHE4 Firefox and Mozilla DOM Node Spoofing
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5, Mozilla before 1.7.9, and Netscape 8.0.2 does not properly verify the associated types of DOM node names within the context of their namespaces, which allows remote attackers to modify certain tag properties, possibly leading to execution of arbitrary script or code, as demonstrated using an XHTML document with IMG tags with custom properties ("XHTML node spoofing").

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: Apache Integer Overflow in pcre_compile.c
metadata.description: Integer overflow in pcre_compile.c in Perl Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) before 6.2, as used in multiple products such as Python, Ethereal, and PHP, allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via quantifier values in regular expressions, which leads to a heap-based buffer overflow.

criteria.comment: 700 Series or 800 Series OS Release 11.00, 11.11, or 11.23

criterion.comment: hpuxwsAPACHE has a version greater than or equal (A|B).2.0.55.0

metadata.title: RHE3 Improper Handling of Synthetic Events in Mozilla
metadata.description: The browser user interface in Firefox before 1.0.5, Mozilla before 1.7.9, and Netscape 8.0.2 and 7.2 does not properly distinguish between user-generated events and untrusted synthetic events, which makes it easier for remote attackers to perform dangerous actions that normally could only be performed manually by the user.

metadata.title: Gaim DoS via Yahoo! Message
metadata.description: Gaim before 1.3.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a Yahoo! message with non-ASCII characters in a file name.

metadata.title: bzip2 Decompression Bomb
metadata.description: bzip2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (hard drive consumption) via a crafted bzip2 file that causes an infinite loop (a.k.a "decompression bomb").

metadata.title: RHE4 Firefox and Mozilla Framed Site Spoofing Vulnerability
metadata.description: A regression error in Firefox 1.0.3 and Mozilla 1.7.7 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary Javascript from one page into the frameset of another site, aka the frame injection spoofing vulnerability, a re-introduction of a vulnerability that was originally identified and addressed by CVE-2004-0718.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: Apache HTTP Byte-range DoS Vulnerability
metadata.description: The byte-range filter in Apache 2.0 before 2.0.54 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via an HTTP header with a large Range field.

criteria.comment: 700 Series or 800 Series OS Release 11.00, 11.11, or 11.23

criterion.comment: hpuxwsAPACHE has a version greater than or equal (A|B).2.0.55.0

metadata.title: HP-UX Trusted Mode remshd, Remote Unauthorized Access
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in remshd daemon in HP-UX B.11.00, B.11.11, and B.11.23 while running in "Trusted Mode" allows remote attackers to gain unauthorized system access via unknown attack vectors.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02072
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:tst:3901 - HP-UX Security Advisory - HPSBUX02944_101
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:tst:3704 - HP-UX Security Advisories published in February 2014

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02072
Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02072
Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02072

metadata.title: HP-UX ftpd Remote Unauthorized Data Access (B.10.01, B.10.10)
metadata.description: The FTP server in HP-UX 10.20, B.11.00, and B.11.11, allows remote attackers to list arbitrary directories as root by running the LIST command before logging in.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Updated the datatype from 'string' to 'fileset_revision' to match Schematron rules.

criteria.comment: 700 Series or 800 Series OS Release 10.01 or 10.10

metadata.title: RHE3 Mozilla top.focus() Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5 and Mozilla before 1.7.9 allows a child frame to call top.focus and other methods in a parent frame, even when the parent is in a different domain, which violates the same origin policy and allows remote attackers to steal sensitive information such as cookies and passwords from web sites whose child frames do not verify that they are in the same domain as their parents.

metadata.title: RHE3 InstallVersion.compareTo() DoS and Code Execution Vulnerability
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5, Mozilla before 1.7.9, and Netscape 8.0.2 and 7.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (access violation and crash), and possibly execute arbitrary code, by calling InstallVersion.compareTo with an object instead of a string.

metadata.title: RHE4 XBL Script Security Bypass Vulnerability
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5, Thunderbird before 1.0.5, Mozilla before 1.7.9, Netscape 8.0.2, and K-Meleon 0.9 runs XBL scripts even when Javascript has been disabled, which makes it easier for remote attackers to bypass such protection.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: RHE3 Firefox and Mozilla Shared Object Code Execution
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5 and Mozilla before 1.7.9 does not properly clone base objects, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by navigating the prototype chain to reach a privileged object.

metadata.title: Apache HTTP Request Smuggling
metadata.description: The Apache HTTP server before 1.3.34, and 2.0.x before 2.0.55, when acting as an HTTP proxy, allows remote attackers to poison the web cache, bypass web application firewall protection, and conduct XSS attacks via an HTTP request with both a "Transfer-Encoding: chunked" header and a Content-Length header, which causes Apache to incorrectly handle and forward the body of the request in a way that causes the receiving server to process it as a separate HTTP request, aka "HTTP Request Smuggling."

criteria.comment: 700 Series or 800 Series OS Release 11.00, 11.11, or 11.23

criterion.comment: hpuxwsAPACHE has a version greater than or equal (A|B).2.0.55.0

metadata.title: Magick XWD Decoder DoS
metadata.description: The XWD Decoder in ImageMagick before 6.2.2.3, and GraphicsMagick before 1.1.6-r1, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via an image with a zero color mask.

metadata.title: HP-UX ftpd Remote Unauthorized Data Access (B.11.04)
metadata.description: The FTP server in HP-UX 10.20, B.11.00, and B.11.11, allows remote attackers to list arbitrary directories as root by running the LIST command before logging in.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Updated the datatype from 'string' to 'fileset_revision' to match Schematron rules.

criteria.comment: InternetSrvcs.INETSVCS-RUN, InternetSrvcs.INET-ENG-A-MAN, or VirtualVaultOS.VVOS-AUX-IA (B.11.04) is installed

metadata.title: RHE3 Fetchmail Buffer Overflow via Long UIDL Responses
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the POP3 client in Fetchmail before 6.2.5.2 allows remote POP3 servers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via long UIDL responses. NOTE: a typo in an advisory accidentally used the wrong CVE identifier for the Fetchmail issue. This is the correct identifier.

metadata.title: SNMP Trap Handling Vulnerability
metadata.description: Vulnerabilities in a large number of SNMP implementations allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service or gain privileges via SNMPv1 trap handling, as demonstrated by the PROTOS c06-SNMPv1 test suite. NOTE: It is highly likely that this candidate will be SPLIT into multiple candidates, one or more for each vendor. This and other SNMP-related candidates will be updated when more accurate information is available.

metadata.title: RHE4 Firefox External App Code Acceptance Vulnerability
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5 allows remote attackers to steal information and possibly execute arbitrary code by using standalone applications such as Flash and QuickTime to open a javascript: URL, which is run in the context of the previous page, and may lead to code execution if the standalone application loads a privileged chrome: URL.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: gzip Argument Sanitation Vulnerability
metadata.description: zgrep in gzip before 1.3.5 does not properly sanitize arguments, which allows local users to execute arbitrary commands via filenames that are injected into a sed script.

metadata.title: PostgreSQL tsearch2 "internal" Functions Vulnerability
metadata.description: The tsearch2 module in PostgreSQL 7.4 through 8.0.x declares the (1) dex_init, (2) snb_en_init, (3) snb_ru_init, (4) spell_init, and (5) syn_init functions as "internal" even when they do not take an internal argument, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly have other impacts via SQL commands that call other functions that accept internal arguments.

criterion.comment: postmaster (the PostgreSQL master daemon) is running
/usr/lib/pgsql/tsearch.so (PostgreSQL's tsearch module) exists as a regular file

metadata.title: gzip zgrep Sanitation Vulnerability
metadata.description: zgrep in gzip before 1.3.5 does not properly sanitize arguments, which allows local users to execute arbitrary commands via filenames that are injected into a sed script.

metadata.title: Kerberos V5 Null Pointer DoS Vulnerability
metadata.description: MIT Kerberos V5 Key Distribution Center (KDC) before 1.2.5 allows remote authenticated attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) on KDCs within the same realm via a certain protocol request that causes a null dereference.

criteria.comment: Solaris 7 and Solaris Enterprise Authentication Mechanism OR Solaris 8 or 9 installed
Solaris 7 AND Solaris Enterprise Authentication Mechanism installed

criterion.comment: Sun Enterprise Authentication Mechanism (SEAM, SUNWkr5sv) installed
Sun Enterprise Authentication Mechanism (SEAM, SUNWkr5sl) installed
Sun Enterprise Authentication Mechanism (SEAM, SUNWkrgdo) installed
Sun Enterprise Authentication Mechanism (SEAM, SUNWkrggl) installed
/etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain

metadata.title: mlock Memory Page Tracking Vulnerability
metadata.description: The linux-2.4.21-mlock.patch in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 3 does not properly maintain the mlock page count when one process unlocks pages that belong to another process, which allows local users to mlock more memory than specified by the rlimit.

criteria.comment: kernel, kernel-smp or kernel-hugemem RPM earlier than 0:2.4.21-32.0.1.EL

metadata.title: Linux Kernel elf_core_dump() Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: The elf_core_dump function in binfmt_elf.c for Linux kernel 2.x.x to 2.2.27-rc2, 2.4.x to 2.4.31-pre1, and 2.6.x to 2.6.12-rc4 allows local users to execute arbitrary code via an ELF binary that, in certain conditions involving the create_elf_tables function, causes a negative length argument to pass a signed integer comparison, leading to a buffer overflow.

criteria.comment: kernel, kernel-smp or kernel-hugemem RPM earlier than 0:2.4.21-32.0.1.EL

metadata.title: RHE4 Fetchmail Buffer Overflow via Long UIDL Responses
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the POP3 client in Fetchmail before 6.2.5.2 allows remote POP3 servers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via long UIDL responses. NOTE: a typo in an advisory accidentally used the wrong CVE identifier for the Fetchmail issue. This is the correct identifier.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: Buffer Overflows in uucp
metadata.description: Multiple buffer overflows in uucp for Sun Solaris 2.6, 7, 8, and 9 allow local users to execute arbitrary code as the uucp user.

modified.comment: Product set to uucp; was mistakenly .NET framework

metadata.title: Telnet Client Information Disclosure Vulnerability
metadata.description: Certain BSD-based Telnet clients, including those used on Solaris and SuSE Linux, allow remote malicious Telnet servers to read sensitive environment variables via the NEW-ENVIRON option with a SEND ENV_USERVAR command.

metadata.title: HP-UX Trusted Mode remshd Remote Unauthorized Access (B.11.11)
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in remshd daemon in HP-UX B.11.00, B.11.11, and B.11.23 while running in "Trusted Mode" allows remote attackers to gain unauthorized system access via unknown attack vectors.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Updated the datatype from 'string' to 'fileset_revision' to match Schematron rules.

metadata.title: bzip2 Arbitrary File Permission Modification Vulnerability
metadata.description: Race condition in bzip2 1.0.2 and earlier allows local users to modify permissions of arbitrary files via a hard link attack on a file while it is being decompressed, whose permissions are changed by bzip2 after the decompression is complete.

metadata.title: gzip Hard Link Attack
metadata.description: Race condition in gzip 1.2.4, 1.3.3, and earlier, when decompressing a gzipped file, allows local users to modify permissions of arbitrary files via a hard link attack on a file while it is being decompressed, whose permissions are changed by gzip after the decompression is complete.

metadata.title: RHE3 Firefox External App Code Acceptance Vulnerability
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5 allows remote attackers to steal information and possibly execute arbitrary code by using standalone applications such as Flash and QuickTime to open a javascript: URL, which is run in the context of the previous page, and may lead to code execution if the standalone application loads a privileged chrome: URL.

metadata.title: Multiple Buffer Overflows in libXML2
metadata.description: Multiple buffer overflows in libXML 2.6.12 and 2.6.13 (libxml2), and possibly other versions, may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via (1) a long FTP URL that is not properly handled by the xmlNanoFTPScanURL function, (2) a long proxy URL containing FTP data that is not properly handled by the xmlNanoFTPScanProxy function, and other overflows related to manipulation of DNS length values, including (3) xmlNanoFTPConnect, (4) xmlNanoHTTPConnectHost, and (5) xmlNanoHTTPConnectHost.

criteria.comment: libxml or libxml-devel RPM is earlier than 1:1.8.17-9.2

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Multiple Buffer Overflows in libgd
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Multiple buffer overflows in the gd graphics library (libgd) 2.0.21 and earlier may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via malformed image files that trigger the overflows due to improper calls to the gdMalloc function, a different set of vulnerabilities than CVE-2004-0990.

oval-def:criteria.comment: libgd or libgd-devel RPM is earlier than 0:1.8.4-12.3.1

metadata.title: HP-UX ftpd Remote Unauthorized Data Access (B.10.24)
metadata.description: The FTP server in HP-UX 10.20, B.11.00, and B.11.11, allows remote attackers to list arbitrary directories as root by running the LIST command before logging in.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change

metadata.title: Linux Kernel shmctl() Memory Swap Vulnerability
metadata.description: The shmctl function in Linux 2.6.9 and earlier allows local users to unlock the memory of other processes, which could cause sensitive memory to be swapped to disk, which could allow it to be read by other users once it has been released.

criteria.comment: kernel, kernel-smp or kernel-hugemem RPM earlier than 0:2.4.21-32.0.1.EL

metadata.title: RHE4 Improper Handling of Synthetic Events in Mozilla
metadata.description: The browser user interface in Firefox before 1.0.5, Mozilla before 1.7.9, and Netscape 8.0.2 and 7.2 does not properly distinguish between user-generated events and untrusted synthetic events, which makes it easier for remote attackers to perform dangerous actions that normally could only be performed manually by the user.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: Mozilla FTP URI MIME Type Exploit Vulnerability
metadata.description: Mozilla allows remote attackers to cause Mozilla to open a URI as a different MIME type than expected via a null character (%00) in an FTP URI.

metadata.title: sudo Symlink Vulnerability
metadata.description: Race condition in sudo 1.3.1 up to 1.6.8p8, when the ALL pseudo-command is used after a user entry in the sudoers file, allows local users to gain privileges via a symlink attack.

notes.note: It appears that we can't parse the vulnerable configuration condition (an ALL in the second field of a line after a line that has no ALL in the second field) with our existing regexp.

metadata.title: gedit Format String Vulnerability
metadata.description: Format string vulnerability in gedit 2.10.2 may allow attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a bin file with format string specifiers in the filename. NOTE: while this issue is triggered on the command line by the gedit user, it has been reported that web browsers and email clients could be configured to provide a file name as an argument to gedit, so there is a valid attack that crosses security boundaries.

modified.comment: Corrected version string in ste:929. Implemented by Jon Baker of The MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: RHE3 Firefox and Mozilla DOM Node Spoofing
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5, Mozilla before 1.7.9, and Netscape 8.0.2 does not properly verify the associated types of DOM node names within the context of their namespaces, which allows remote attackers to modify certain tag properties, possibly leading to execution of arbitrary script or code, as demonstrated using an XHTML document with IMG tags with custom properties ("XHTML node spoofing").

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Integer Overflow in libgd2
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Integer overflow in GD Graphics Library libgd 2.0.28 (libgd2), and possibly other versions, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via PNG image files with large image rows values that lead to a heap-based buffer overflow in the gdImageCreateFromPngCtx function, a different set of vulnerabilities than CVE-2004-0941.

oval-def:criteria.comment: libgd or libgd-devel RPM is earlier than 0:1.8.4-12.3.1

metadata.title: RHE3 Firefox and Mozilla Javascript Dialog Box Spoofing
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5 and Mozilla before 1.7.9 does not clearly associate a Javascript dialog box with the web page that generated it, which allows remote attackers to spoof a dialog box from a trusted site and facilitates phishing attacks, aka the "Dialog Origin Spoofing Vulnerability."

metadata.title: HP-UX ftpd Remote Unauthorized Data Access
metadata.description: The FTP server in HP-UX 10.20, B.11.00, and B.11.11, allows remote attackers to list arbitrary directories as root by running the LIST command before logging in.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02071

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02071
Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02071

metadata.title: RHE3 Firefox InstallTrigger Callback Vulnerability
metadata.description: The InstallTrigger.install method in Firefox before 1.0.5 and Mozilla before 1.7.9 allows remote attackers to execute a callback function in the context of another domain by forcing a page navigation after the install method has been called, which causes the callback to be run in the context of the new page and results in a same origin violation.

metadata.title: Mozilla IDN heap overrun using soft-hyphens
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the International Domain Name (IDN) support in Mozilla Firefox 1.0.6 and earlier, and Netscape 8.0.3.3 and 7.2, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a hostname with all "soft" hyphens (character 0xAD), which is not properly handled by the NormalizeIDN call in nsStandardURL::BuildNormalizedSpec.

criteria.comment: 700 Series or 800 Series OS Release 11.00, 11.11, 11.22, or 11.23

criterion.comment: Mozilla v1.7.12 (1.7.12.0.00) or later is installed

metadata.title: RHE4 Firefox InstallTrigger Callback Vulnerability
metadata.description: The InstallTrigger.install method in Firefox before 1.0.5 and Mozilla before 1.7.9 allows remote attackers to execute a callback function in the context of another domain by forcing a page navigation after the install method has been called, which causes the callback to be run in the context of the new page and results in a same origin violation.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: RHE4 Firefox and Mozilla Javascript Dialog Box Spoofing
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5 and Mozilla before 1.7.9 does not clearly associate a Javascript dialog box with the web page that generated it, which allows remote attackers to spoof a dialog box from a trusted site and facilitates phishing attacks, aka the "Dialog Origin Spoofing Vulnerability."

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: Apache mod_ssl CRL off-by-one DoS
metadata.description: Off-by-one error in the mod_ssl Certificate Revocation List (CRL) verification callback in Apache, when configured to use a CRL, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (child process crash) via a CRL that causes a buffer overflow of one null byte.

criteria.comment: 700 Series or 800 Series OS Release 11.00, 11.11, or 11.23

criterion.comment: hpuxwsAPACHE has a version greater than or equal (A|B).2.0.55.0

metadata.title: RHE3 XBL Script Security Bypass Vulnerability
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5, Thunderbird before 1.0.5, Mozilla before 1.7.9, Netscape 8.0.2, and K-Meleon 0.9 runs XBL scripts even when Javascript has been disabled, which makes it easier for remote attackers to bypass such protection.

metadata.title: RHE4 Mozilla top.focus() Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
metadata.description: Firefox before 1.0.5 and Mozilla before 1.7.9 allows a child frame to call top.focus and other methods in a parent frame, even when the parent is in a different domain, which violates the same origin policy and allows remote attackers to steal sensitive information such as cookies and passwords from web sites whose child frames do not verify that they are in the same domain as their parents.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Updated CPE reference, updated regular expression
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:ste:11366 - Corrected - right version for brlapi and brlapi-devel as specified by RHSA-2010:0181-5

metadata.title: HP-UX envd Local Execution of Privileged Code (B.11.00)
metadata.description: envd daemon in HP-UX B.11.00 through B.11.11 allows local users to obtain privileges via unknown attack vectors.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Updated the datatype from 'string' to 'fileset_revision' to match Schematron rules.

metadata.title: HP-UX ftpd Remote Unauthorized Data Access (B.11.11)
metadata.description: The FTP server in HP-UX 10.20, B.11.00, and B.11.11, allows remote attackers to list arbitrary directories as root by running the LIST command before logging in.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Updated the datatype from 'string' to 'fileset_revision' to match Schematron rules.

metadata.title: Samba Encrypted Password DoS
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in samba 2.2.2 through 2.2.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via an encrypted password that causes the overflow during decryption in which a DOS codepage string is converted to a little-endian UCS2 unicode string.

metadata.title: HP-UX ftpd Remote Unauthorized Data Access (B.10.20)
metadata.description: The FTP server in HP-UX 10.20, B.11.00, and B.11.11, allows remote attackers to list arbitrary directories as root by running the LIST command before logging in.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Updated the datatype from 'string' to 'fileset_revision' to match Schematron rules.

metadata.title: Management Console Directory Traversal Vulnerability
metadata.description: The Solaris Management Console (SMC) in Sun Solaris 8 and 9 generates different 404 error messages when a file does not exist versus when a file exists but is otherwise inacessible, which could allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information in conjunction with a directory traversal (..) attack.

modified.comment: Affected product changed to Sun Management Console (SMC); mistakenly was .NET framework

criterion.comment: Solaris Management Console Web Components (SUNWwbmc) installed

metadata.title: ls-F Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in the ls-F builtin function in tcsh on Solaris 8 allows local users to create or delete files as other users, and gain privileges.

modified.comment: Affected product changed to tcsh; mistakenly was .NET framework

metadata.title: HP-UX envd, Local Execution of Privileged Code
metadata.description: envd daemon in HP-UX B.11.00 through B.11.11 allows local users to obtain privileges via unknown attack vectors.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02073
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:tst:3704 - HP-UX Security Advisories published in February 2014

criteria.comment: Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02073
Criteria meets HP Security Bulletin HPSBUX02073

metadata.title: HP-UX Trusted Mode remshd Remote Unauthorized Access (B.11.23)
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in remshd daemon in HP-UX B.11.00, B.11.11, and B.11.23 while running in "Trusted Mode" allows remote attackers to gain unauthorized system access via unknown attack vectors.

modified.comment: modified patch test to only check for specific patch, checking for supersedence was incorrect and need a language change
Updated the datatype from 'string' to 'fileset_revision' to match Schematron rules.

metadata.title: gzip -force File Permission Alteration Vulnerability
metadata.description: gzip before 1.3 in Solaris 8, when called with the -f or -force flags, will change the permissions of files that are hard linked to the target files, which allows local users to view or modify these files.

metadata.title: sendfilev DoS Vulnerability
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in the sendfilev function in Sun Solaris 8 and 9 allows local users to cause a denial of service (system panic) via unknown vectors.

metadata.title: Enterprise Storage Manager 2.1 SAN Manager management station patch
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in Sun StorEdge Enterprise Storage Manager (ESM) 2.1 for Solaris 8 and Solaris 9 allows local users with the "ESMUser" role to gain root access.

modified.comment: Added CVE Reference. Added solaris 9 as an affected platform.

metadata.title: /usr/lib/print/conv_fix Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in conv_fix in Sun Solaris 7 through 9, when invoked by conv_lpd, allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files.

metadata.title: CDE dtspcd Daemon Symlink Vulnerability
metadata.description: The CDE dtspcd daemon allows local users to execute arbitrary commands via a symlink attack.

metadata.title: dtsession Buffer Overflow via HOME Envvar
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in dtsession for Solaris 2.5.1 through Solaris 9 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long HOME environment variable.

metadata.title: Off-by-one Error in fb_realpath()
metadata.description: Off-by-one error in the fb_realpath() function, as derived from the realpath function in BSD, may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code, as demonstrated in wu-ftpd 2.5.0 through 2.6.2 via commands that cause pathnames of length MAXPATHLEN+1 to trigger a buffer overflow, including (1) STOR, (2) RETR, (3) APPE, (4) DELE, (5) MKD, (6) RMD, (7) STOU, or (8) RNTO.

modified.comment: fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

metadata.title: BIND DoS via SIG RR Elements
metadata.description: BIND 8.x through 8.3.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via SIG RR elements with invalid expiry times, which are removed from the internal BIND database and later cause a null dereference.

criterion.comment: Internet Domain Name Server (BIND, SUNWinamd) installed

metadata.title: Sendmail Address Processor Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in Sendmail 5.79 to 8.12.7 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via certain formatted address fields, related to sender and recipient header comments as processed by the crackaddr function of headers.c.

metadata.title: Sun RPC No Timeout Denial of Service on TCP Ports
metadata.description: The Sun RPC functionality in multiple libc implementations does not provide a time-out mechanism when reading data from TCP connections, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (hang).

criteria.comment: All RPC w/TCP patches installed - CVE-2002-1265

metadata.title: Mozilla, Firefox, Thunderbird User Interface Hijacking Vulnerability
metadata.description: Mozilla before 1.7, Firefox before 0.9, and Thunderbird before 0.7, allow remote web sites to hijack the user interface via the "chrome" flag and XML User Interface Language (XUL) files.

metadata.title: ypxfrd File Disclosure Vulnerability
metadata.description: The getdbm procedure in ypxfrd allows local users to read arbitrary files, and remote attackers to read databases outside /var/yp, via a directory traversal and symlink attack on the domain and map arguments.

metadata.title: Kerberos 5 KDC Heap Corruption Vulnerability
metadata.description: The Key Distribution Center (KDC) in Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.2.7 and earlier allows remote, authenticated attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) on KDCs within the same realm using a certain protocol request that causes the KDC to corrupt its heap (aka "buffer underrun").

modified.comment: Added negate=true attribute to criteria sub-block to fix conversion error from OVAL 4.2 to OVAL 5.0

notes.note: Vulnerability exists in standard Solaris kerberos and SEAM. This definition only covers Solaris kerberos

criterion.comment: /etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain

metadata.title: BIND SIG Resource Records Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in named in BIND 4 versions 4.9.10 and earlier, and 8 versions 8.3.3 and earlier, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a certain DNS server response containing SIG resource records (RR).

criterion.comment: Internet Domain Name Server (BIND, SUNWinamd) installed

metadata.title: KCMS KCS_OPEN_PROFILE File Disclosure Vulnerability
metadata.description: Directory traversal vulnerability in Sun Kodak Color Management System (KCMS) library service daemon (kcms_server) allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via the KCS_OPEN_PROFILE procedure.

modified.comment: fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Added platforms for Solaris 8 and 9
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

criterion.comment: Kodak Color Managment Server (KCMS) Runtime Environment (SUNWkcsrt/SUNWkcsrx) installed

metadata.title: XFS Dispatch() Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in Dispatch() routine for XFS font server (fs.auto) on Solaris 2.5.1 through 9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a certain XFS query.

modified.comment: fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

criterion.comment: X Window System Font Server (SUNWxwfs) installed

metadata.title: Solaris TCP/IP Stack System Panic Vulnerability
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in the TCP/IP stack for Sun Solaris 8 and 9 allows local users to cause a denial of service (system panic) via unknown vectors.

metadata.title: CDE AddSuLog Function Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the AddSuLog function of the CDE dtaction utility allows local users to gain root privileges via a long user name.

criterion.comment: CDE application basic runtime environment (SUNWdtbas/SUNWdtbax) installed

metadata.title: Mozilla CA Certificate DoS
metadata.description: Mozilla 1.5 through 1.7 allows a CA certificate to be imported even when their DN is the same as that of the built-in CA root certificate, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service to SSL pages because the malicious certificate is treated as invalid.

metadata.title: Mozilla, Firefox, Thunderbird POP3 SendUidl Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the SendUidl in the POP3 capability for Mozilla before 1.7, Firefox before 0.9, and Thunderbird before 0.7, may allow remote POP3 mail servers to execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: Buffer Overflow in Solaris ping Daemon
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the ping daemon of Sun Solaris 7 through 9 may allow local users to execute arbitrary code.

criteria.comment: Solaris 7 or 8 OR Solaris 9 and Solaris Basic IP Commands (SUNWbip) installed
Solaris 9 and Solaris Basic IP Commands (SUNWbip) installed

metadata.title: SunOS 5.9: ufs and fsck patch
metadata.description: The Sun Solaris Volume Manager (SVM) on Solaris 9 allows local users to cause a denial of service (kernel panic) via a malformed probe request to the SVM.

modified.comment: Corrected operation on line element of textfilecontent_object. Operation must be pattern match.
Updated obj:374: set operation to pattern match on filename.
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:obj:374 - In some "pattern match" strings added "\" before "." to clarify if "point" or "any symbol" needed.

metadata.title: sshd Log Bypass Vulnerability
metadata.description: The Secure Shell (SSH) Daemon (SSHD) in Sun Solaris 9 does not properly log IP addresses when SSHD is configured with the ListenAddress as 0.0.0.0, which makes it easier for remote attackers to hide the source of their activities.

metadata.title: Patches Disable Basic Security Module Auditing Functionality
metadata.description: The patches (1) 114332-08 and (2) 114929-06 for Sun Solaris 9 disable the auditing functionality of the Basic Security Module (BSM), which allows attackers to avoid having their activity logged.

metadata.title: Mozilla, Firefox, Thunderbird Security Lock Icon Spoof Vulnerability
metadata.description: Mozilla before 1.7, Firefox before 0.9, and Thunderbird before 0.7, allow remote attackers to use certain redirect sequences to spoof the security lock icon that makes a web page appear to be encrypted.

metadata.title: priocntl Directory Traversal Vulnerability
metadata.description: Directory traversal vulnerability in priocntl system call in Solaris does allows local users to execute arbitrary code via ".." sequences in the pc_clname field of a pcinfo_t structure, which cause priocntl to load a malicious kernel module.

metadata.title: Buffer Overflow in ntp Daemon via readvar
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in ntpd ntp daemon 4.0.99k and earlier (aka xntpd and xntp3) allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a long readvar argument.

metadata.title: in.named Process Crash Vulnerability
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in in.named on Solaris 8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (process crash).

criterion.comment: Internet Domain Name Server (BIND, SUNWinamd) installed

metadata.title: Mozilla Firefox Certificate Spoofing Vulnerability
metadata.description: Mozilla Firefox 0.9.1 and 0.9.2 allows remote web sites to spoof certificates of trusted web sites via redirects and Javascript that uses the "onunload" method.

metadata.title: Shell Redirect Symlink Attack Vulnerability
metadata.description: Multiple shell programs on various Unix systems, including (1) tcsh, (2) csh, (3) sh, and (4) bash, follow symlinks when processing << redirects (aka here-documents or in-here documents), which allows local users to overwrite files of other users via a symlink attack.

modified.comment: Added Sun Solaris 8 to list of platforms in Affected metadata.
Added negate=true attribute to criteria sub-block to fix conversion error from OVAL 4.2 to OVAL 5.0

metadata.title: Multiple Vulnerabilities in lpstat and libprint
metadata.description: Unknown multiple vulnerabilities in (1) lpstat and (2) the libprint library in Solaris 2.6 through 9 may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code or read or write arbitrary files.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:def:4098 - Split <product>lpstat, libprint</product> in <product>lpstat</product> <product>libprint</product>

criterion.comment: Solaris Print - LP Server - Root (SUNWpsr) installed
Solaris Print - LP Server - Usr (SUNWpsu) installed

metadata.title: Buffer Overflow in DNS Resolver Library
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the DNS resolver code used in libc, glibc, and libbind, as derived from ISC BIND, allows remote malicious DNS servers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via the stub resolvers.

criterion.comment: /etc/nsswitch.conf configured to resolve hosts through DNS

metadata.title: cachefsd DoS via Invalid RPC Request
metadata.description: cachefsd in Solaris 2.6, 7, and 8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via an invalid procedure call in an RPC request.

modified.comment: fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

metadata.title: ToolTalk Buffer Overflow via TT_SESSION Envvar
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in TT_SESSION environment variable in ToolTalk shared library allows local users to gain root privileges.

metadata.title: lpq Buffer Overflow in bsd_queue()
metadata.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the bsd_queue() function for lpq on Solaris 2.6 and 7 allows local users to gain root privilege.

metadata.title: Mozilla, Firefox, Thunderbird XPInstall Security Vulnerability
metadata.description: Mozilla before 1.7, Firefox before 0.9, and Thunderbird before 0.7, allow remote web sites to install arbitrary extensions by using interactive events to manipulate the XPInstall Security dialog box.

metadata.title: Kerberos 5 KDC Buffer Underrun in Principle Name Handling
metadata.description: The Key Distribution Center (KDC) in Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.2.7 and earlier allows remote, authenticated attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) on KDCs within the same realm using a certain protocol request that causes the KDC to corrupt its heap (aka "buffer underrun").

modified.comment: Added negate=true attribute to criteria sub-block to fix conversion error from OVAL 4.2 to OVAL 5.0

notes.note: Vulnerability exists in standard Solaris kerberos and SEAM. This definition only covers SEAM

criterion.comment: Sun Enterprise Authentication Mechanism (SEAM, SUNWkr5sv) installed

metadata.title: Solaris Code Execution DoS Vulnerability
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in Solaris 2.6 through 9 causes a denial of service (system panic) via "a rare race condition" or an attack by local users.

metadata.title: Mozilla, Netscape SOAPParameter Integer Overflow
metadata.description: Integer overflow in the SOAPParameter object constructor in (1) Netscape version 7.0 and 7.1 and (2) Mozilla 1.6, and possibly earlier versions, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: SunRPC xdr_array Function Integer Overflow
metadata.description: Integer overflow in xdr_array function in RPC servers for operating systems that use libc, glibc, or other code based on SunRPC including dietlibc, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by passing a large number of arguments to xdr_array through RPC services such as rpc.cmsd and dmispd.

modified.comment: Added negate=true attribute to criteria sub-block to fix conversion error from OVAL 4.2 to OVAL 5.0

notes.note: Specific applications using this library are not tested for because Suns advisory only provides a sample of known vulnerable applications and states that they are still investigating.

metadata.title: Mozilla, Firebird, Firefox Frame Injection Vulnerability
metadata.description: The (1) Mozilla 1.6, (2) Firebird 0.7, (3) Firefox 0.8, and (4) Netscape 7.1 web browsers do not properly prevent a frame in one domain from injecting content into a frame that belongs to another domain, which facilitates web site spoofing and other attacks, aka the frame injection vulnerability.

metadata.title: LDAP RBAC Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in LDAP on Sun Solaris 8 and 9, when using Role Based Access Control (RBAC), allows local users to execute certain commands with additional privileges.

criterion.comment: /etc/nsswitch.conf configured to use LDAP with RBAC

metadata.title: CDE libDtHelp Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in CDE libDtHelp library allows local users to execute arbitrary code via (1) a modified DTHELPUSERSEARCHPATH environment variable and the Help feature, (2) DTSEARCHPATH, or (3) LOGNAME.

modified.comment: Added product

criteria.comment: CDE Application Runtime or CDE Separable Help (any SUNWdtbas/SUNWdtbax/SUNWdthep) installed

criterion.comment: CDE application basic runtime environment (SUNWdtbas/SUNWdtbax) installed

metadata.title: Apache Nonce Verification Response Replay Vulnerability
metadata.description: mod_digest for Apache before 1.3.31 does not properly verify the nonce of a client response by using a AuthNonce secret.

criteria.comment: Solaris 8 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 8 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 9 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 9 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.

metadata.title: Apache Error Log Escape Sequence Filtering Vulnerability
metadata.description: Apache does not filter terminal escape sequences from its error logs, which could make it easier for attackers to insert those sequences into terminal emulators containing vulnerabilities related to escape sequences.

criteria.comment: Solaris 8 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 8 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 9 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 9 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.

metadata.title: Apache Listening Socket Starvation Vulnerability
metadata.description: Apache 1.4.x before 1.3.30, and 2.0.x before 2.0.49, when using multiple listening sockets on certain platforms, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (blocked new connections) via a "short-lived connection on a rarely-accessed listening socket."

modified.comment: Modified to AND the 'Apache running' test with the 'Software Section' criteria

criteria.comment: Is a vulnerable software version installed and is Apache running
Solaris 8 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 8 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 9 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 9 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.

metadata.title: Apache Allow/Deny Parsing Error
metadata.description: mod_access in Apache 1.3 before 1.3.30, when running big-endian 64-bit platforms, does not properly parse Allow/Deny rules using IP addresses without a netmask, which could allow remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions.

criteria.comment: Solaris 8 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 9 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.

metadata.title: Apache mod_proxy Content-Length Header Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in proxy_util.c for mod_proxy in Apache 1.3.25 to 1.3.31 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (process crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a negative Content-Length HTTP header field, which causes a large amount of data to be copied.

modified.comment: Corrected the logic in the criteria.

criteria.comment: Applicable version of Solaris is running
Solaris 8 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 8 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 9 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.
Solaris 9 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101555 criteria.

metadata.title: X Display Manager DoS via Invalid XDMCP Request
metadata.description: X Display Manager (XDM) on Solaris 8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (XDM crash) via an invalid X Display Manager Control Protocol (XDMCP) request.

modified.comment: Added CVE #

criteria.comment: Solaris 8 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101549 criteria.
Solaris 8 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101549 criteria.
Solaris 9 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101549 criteria.
Solaris 9 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101549 criteria.

metadata.title: libtiff RLE Decoder Buffer Overflow Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities in the RLE (run length encoding) decoders for libtiff 3.6.1 and earlier, related to buffer overflows and integer overflows, allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via TIFF files.

criteria.comment: Solaris 7 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.
Solaris 7 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.
Solaris 8 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.
Solaris 8 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.
Solaris 9 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.

Solaris 10 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.
Solaris 10 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.

metadata.title: libtiff tif_dirread divide-by-zero Denial of Service
metadata.description: Vulnerability in tif_dirread.c for libtiff allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a TIFF image that causes a divide-by-zero error when the number of row bytes is zero, a different vulnerability than CVE-2005-2452.

Solaris 7 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.

metadata.title: libtiff Malloc Error Denial of Service
metadata.description: Multiple integer overflows in libtiff 3.6.1 and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash or memory corruption) via TIFF images that lead to incorrect malloc calls.

criteria.comment: Solaris 7 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.
Solaris 7 (x86) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.
Solaris 8 (SPARC) meets Sun Alert ID 101677 criteria.

metadata.title: libtiff Directory Entry Count Integer Overflow Vulnerability
metadata.description: Integer overflow in (1) tif_dirread.c and (2) tif_fax3.c for libtiff 3.5.7 and 3.7.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a TIFF file containing a TIFF_ASCII or TIFF_UNDEFINED directory entry with a -1 entry count, which leads to a heap-based buffer overflow.

textfilecontent_test.comment: /etc/nsswitch.conf configured to use LDAP with RBAC
/etc/nsswitch.conf configured to resolve hosts through DNS

package_test.comment: Solaris Print - LP Server - Usr (SUNWpsu) installed
Solaris Print - LP Server - Root (SUNWpsr) installed

oval-def:notes.oval-def:note: The presence of /etc/named.conf indicates that system system is probably configured as a DNS server

package_test.comment: CDE application basic runtime environment (SUNWdtbas/SUNWdtbax) installed
X Window System Font Server (SUNWxwfs) installed
Kodak Color Managment Server (KCMS) Runtime Environment (SUNWkcsrt/SUNWkcsrx) installed
Solaris Management Console Web Components (SUNWwbmc) installed

swlist_test.comment: Mozilla v1.7.12 (1.7.12.0.00) or later is installed

textfilecontent_test.comment: /etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain

oval-def:notes.oval-def:note: Rough translation of the Sun recommended test of: % grep default_realm /etc/krb5/krb5.conf | grep -v ___default_realm___ default_realm = EXAMPLE.COM

package_test.comment: Sun Enterprise Authentication Mechanism (SEAM, SUNWkrggl) installed
Sun Enterprise Authentication Mechanism (SEAM, SUNWkrgdo) installed
Sun Enterprise Authentication Mechanism (SEAM, SUNWkr5sl) installed
Sun Enterprise Authentication Mechanism (SEAM, SUNWkr5sv) installed

file_test.comment: /usr/lib/pgsql/tsearch.so (PostgreSQL's tsearch module) exists as a regular file

ns1:notes.ns1:note: The ImageMagick-* RPMs all require that the main ImageMagick RPM have the same version and release number.

swlist_test.comment: hpuxwsAPACHE has a version greater than or equal (A|B).2.0.55.0

ns1:notes.ns1:note: The ImageMagick-devel, ImageMagick-c++-devel, and ImageMagick-c++ RPMs all require that the exact same version of the ImageMagick RPM is present. As such, we can test for a vulnerable version of the former alone, rather than testing for the presence of each of these RPMs in particular.

process_test.comment: postmaster (the PostgreSQL master daemon) is running

ns1:notes.ns1:note: Multiple RPMs were updated in this release, but all but mozilla-nspr have mozilla-with-their-same-version as an installation dependency. So, if mozilla is up to date, mozilla-chat, mozilla-devel, ... , mozilla-js-debugger are all up to date. Mozilla itself requires that mozilla-nspr and mozilla-nss be installed with the same version as itself. This closes the loop -- if mozilla is up to date, so are the other mozilla-FOO RPMs.

oval-def:notes.oval-def:note: For "/tmp is readable by non-root users," use a compound test.

package_test.comment: Remote Network Server Commands - Usr (SUNWrcmds) installed
Internet Domain Name Server (BIND, SUNWinamd) installed

ns1:notes.ns1:note: Multiple RPMs were updated in this release, but all but mozilla-nspr have mozilla-with-their-same-version as an installation dependency. So, if mozilla is up to date, mozilla-chat, mozilla-devel, ... , mozilla-js-debugger are all up to date. Mozilla itself requires that mozilla-nspr and mozilla-nss be installed with the same version as itself. This closes the loop -- if mozilla is up to date, so are the other mozilla-FOO RPMs.
